messages.author: brettw
messages.text:
It seems like this function should return false for cases where it doesn't know how to convert the colors. Can we add that detection?

When we add that, I wonder if the new function is necessary. Is it reasonable from the calling code's perspective to try to capture it, and if that fails, fall back on explicitly asking for a tab capture? It seems like that might be better handling anyway for the errors that can already occur in capturing.

messages.author: Sam Kerner (Chrome)
messages.text:
On 2010/03/11 19:40:01, brettw wrote:
> It seems like this function should return false for cases where it doesn't know
> how to convert the colors. Can we add that detection?
> 
> When we add that, I wonder if the new function is necessary. Is it reasonable
> from the calling code's perspective to try to capture it, and if that fails,
> fall back on explicitly asking for a tab capture? It seems like that might be
> better handling anyway for the errors that can already occur in capturing.

That method is reasonable, but it means the other user of CopyFromBackingStore() needs to be updated as well.  That use is the creation of tab thumbnails.  I took a look at that code, and it does handle failures of CopyFromBackingStore() gracefully.  So, I changed CopyFromBackingStore() as you recommend.

messages.author: brettw
messages.text: Don't put blank lines around this (for derived classes we put all the functions together under one commend listing the source of the override).
